Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's provided students with helpful and timely feedback
The instructor established a positive learning environment
The instructor raised questions or problems that encouraged me to think critically
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: Maybe around 3 hours a week

I think it is a fantastic class that should remain a small seminar to facilitate discussion. The readings were a great addition. I think more guest speakers should be added to gain a better understanding of stigma related work.

I really appreciated the way this course was structured and the many interesting topics we covered throughout. I also appreciated how the course assignments were scaffolded so that they all built towards the final project. I think the professor asked thought-provoking questions and varied the course content through the use of videos, guest lecturers, and debates.

I think that the main way the course could be improved would be to provide better guidance for the debates, including more preparation for debaters and clearer criteria for observers/evaluators.

One reason the course was successful in my opinion was due to small class size -- it was much easier to speak up in class, which is something I rarely did in previous classes. Having weekly assignments to respond to the readings certainly helped with getting me to engage with the material, and maintain my interest and investment in what I wanted to research for the semester-long final paper.
This is the best course Ive taken at YSPH. Katie creates an amazing safe learning environment and its such an important concept to fully understand in public health.
Katie is GREAT! I loved her energy and feedback. The activities in class were insightful. She really made the class feel like a family.

Dr. Wang did an excellent job of covering course material and providing timely feedback on assignments. I really appreciated her thoughtful attempts to integrate student voice in the discussion of key concepts in stigma research. I also appreciate her variation of class time through the use of video clips, guest speakers, and time for student sharing.
Katie was great -- super responsive, super supportive, and I think I appreciated most how she also had something constructive to say after each student response/presentation.
Katie is the best! She is so intelligent, approachable and the readings / lessons were incredibly well curated and taught.
Dr. Wang is an excellent instructor and I really enjoyed this course.
I would highly recommend this course
I would recommend! I think it is the perfect balance of learning and application.

An excellent course for anyone who is doing work where stigma is relevant (read: everyone). I appreciate how this course deepened my understanding of how to assess and address stigma in public health research and practice.

Honestly, I don't know how this course would have been with a larger class. I think the main reason I enjoyed it so much was because there weren't too many students, so we all got to be quite friendly and familiar with each other.
This is an excellent, essential public health class. Katie presents the material in a very approachable way, and creates space for individual exploration and growth. Highly recommend!
This is an excellent course. Dr. Wang is very knowledgeable and the lectures are well-organized and very informative.
